summary: This bill, the Stop Chinese Fentanyl Act of 2025, aims to impose sanctions on Chinese producers of synthetic opioids and precursor chemicals. It directs the President to identify and sanction entities and officials in China involved in fentanyl trafficking. The bill amends existing legislation (the Fentanyl Sanctions Act, the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, and the Trading with the Enemy Act) to strengthen monitoring, reporting, and enforcement related to this issue. It also clarifies that import sanctions are generally not included.
